result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick L Hampton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 4 days time served. Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply work and treatment.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessment, and supervision, and DNA fees prior to the end of the probationary period.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
Maintain full time/part time employment and or schooling.

Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
Defendant shall not be in possession of any firearms or weapons during the period of probation.

No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
Random urine screens with no positive results.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick L Hampton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply work and treatment.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 9 MONTHS with the follow conditions:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessment, and supervision, and DNA fees prior to the end of the probationary period.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  Defendant shall not be in possession of any firearms or weapons during the period of probation.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant Derrick L Hampton in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Derrick L Hampton in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 45.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.45 for a Pretrial Conference.

Defendant Derrick L Hampton in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM052584  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
11-26-2015
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
